comments.body:
based on https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/43865#issuecomment-705818053, can we have the toolchain be a separate flag instead of being part of `TAGS`?

Copying my suggestion here (and adding in some additional error checking):

```make
TOOLCHAIN :=gcc
ifeq ($(TOOLCHAIN), gcc))
  # default to gcc
  CXX_TOOL := g++
  CC_TOOL := gcc
  AR_TOOL := ar
else ifeq ($(TOOLCHAIN), armclang))
  CXX_TOOL := armclang++?
  CC_TOOL := ?
  AR_TOOL :=?
else
  $(error "Invalid TOOLCHAIN: "$(TOOLCHAIN))
endif
```
Ok, will use TOOLCHAIN instead of TAGS.
could you describe what the reason for having maxdepth=2 is? what issue were you running into without this?

Without limiting maxdepth to 2, this command is finding all Makefile.inc files from examples and its target specific Makefiles, that are also included in example Makefile.inc. This makes that target specific Makefile from example is included twice, e.g. in micro_speech example:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/3448ea1f3d321d9d3d0487b1680a75a5c7ce05bd/tensorflow/lite/micro/examples/micro_speech/Makefile.inc#L238
Thanks. Please add the comment about avoiding repeated includes via the maxdepth to the Makefile.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +111,115 @@# main example Makefile.
# See examples/micro_speech/Makefile.inc for an example.
MICRO_LITE_EXAMPLE_TESTS := $(shell find tensorflow/lite/micro/examples/ -maxdepth 2 -name Makefile.inc)
MICRO_LITE_BENCHMARKS := $(wildcard tensorflow/lite/micro/benchmarks/Makefile.inc)

comments.body: while this would remove the warnings, it would mean that person_model_grayscale is downloaded irrespective of the build target and platform, which is something that we currently want to avoid. The warnings are not great, and a different solution that allows for selective downloads without warnings would be ideal.
resolving. I hadn't realized that this download was already being added for all targets and platforms.
